data.title: Did not like to be at the "Extended"
data.text: I stayed here for work. I checked in and was told that I was upgraded to the "Extended" Hotel. Come to find out my room was almost a two-block walk from the "main hotel."  They will tell you it's a block, but it's long and feels like two. The "Extended" is new and beautiful, but as a woman traveling alone on business, arriving at night, I did not feel safe traveling between the  front desk and my front door in the dark, late or early. I really wasn't given a choice. I was assured it's safe, but this being my first time in Lawrence, how do I know?  The "extended" doesn't have a front desk or any security staff. You key with your key card and key into your room. I heard noises, etc., in the hallway at night and became frightened. I just didn't feel relaxed with the lack of security. I checked out in the morning. They should give travelers a choice before assuming they'll be okay with the distance and lack of security presence. Especially solo female travelers. :-(

data.title: Beautiful and friendly
data.text: Hotel is beautiful. Staff is super friendly. Food at restaurant was surprisingly reasonably priced and delicious.  Loved the white noise machine, large tv's, bed comfortable.  The bathroom could have been cleaned better but other than that no complaints.

data.title: Great old hotel in the middle of Lawrence, Kansas
data.text:
I loved my one night stay at the Eldridge Hotel.  It has a perfect location, right in the middle of the Lawrence, Kansas commercial district.  Bookstores, restaurants, coffee shops, and everything else you would expect to find in a college town are within walking distance of the hotel lobby.  My suite consisted of a bedroom, a sitting room and a bathroom.  Even though a wedding reception took place the night I was there, I was not bothered by any noise after ten o'clock that evening.  I noticed ear plugs and a sound machine next to the bed for guests with sensitive ears, but they were not needed.  
I had two excellent meals in the hotel restaurant, and I used the hotel computer in the basement to make reservations further down the road.  If you want to be in the center of activity in Lawrence, this is the place to stay.

data.title: No sightings
data.text: Nice historic hotel on Lawrence's main street. Legends abound. Even stayed in the notorious Room 506 where Colonel Eldridge's ghost is said to hover. But no sighting unfortunately. Just a restful night, friendly staff, and a good breakfast.

data.title: Comfort and Beauty
data.text: The hotel is very nicely decorated and makes you feel comfortable.  It reminds me of the classy hotels of years ago.  There are many cafes and shopping boutiques within easy walking distance.  The view of the downtown area is the best.  If you want comfort with class stay at the Eldridge.

data.title: A little slice of nostalgia and heaven!
data.text: You will not be disappointed in these accommodations. From Check in to check out, the staff was friendly and helpful. The layout of the room is excellent. The cleaning staff take great pride in their work. Valet parking is a great decision for this location as it is hard to find a parking place in downtown Lawrence. Lots of shopping within walking distance. The food and drinks in the Eldridge are excellent, but there are tons of food options in the downtown area. I indulged in room service for breakfast... best decision ever.

data.title: Disappointed In Room Assignment and No Call From Management
data.text:
We have stayed in the Eldridge Extended Stay building of the Eldridge Hotel several times when we have been in Lawrence on business and have always enjoyed the large room and its proximity to the business meeting we were attending.  This year, as in past years, when making our reservation, several months in advance of our arrival, we asked for the Extended Stay building, and this was noted on our reservation paperwork.

When arriving to check into our room, we were told we were not being placed in the Extended Stay building, but rather in the main hotel, which is several blocks from the Extended Stay building.   When we registered our complaint about not being in the Extended Stay building to the check-in personnel, we were told they could do nothing about it.  We asked to speak to the manager, who they said was not in the building, but assured us that the manager, or someone in management, would call us the next day to discuss the matter.  It has been a month and NO ONE has called us.  What a disappointment!!

We feel that when the person making the room assignments saw we had requested the Extended Stay building and were not going to be placed there, they should have called us in advance to explain the situation and tell us we were being placed in the main hotel, which as I have stated is not what we requested.  

This stay at the Eldridge Hotel has been a disappointment.  The AC is noisy and blows right onto the bed and our room faced Massachusetts St. which is very noisy even at night because of the restaurants/bars and traffic along the street.  

When a problem occurs that can't be solved by the desk personnel, upper management should be responsive and should never fail to contact the guests particularly if the guests have requested to speak to management.

data.title: Excellent old meets new.
data.text: Absolutely friendly and helpful staff. Pictures and decor in lobby give you a real sense of the history of this hotel. Modern touches like big HD tv's, wifi worked just fine, no issues with anything at all. The staff and the history make this place a must stay. Plenty of shops and restaurants - places to walk to and enjoy, this hotel is right on the main road through town. Very enjoyable experience.

data.title: Nice with some touches and need for improvement
data.text:
This is a nice old downtown hotel.
Lawrence is lovely so it's great to be steps away from everything!  Bed was comfy.  But noise from street and train could be problematic. Was impressed that each room had a white noise machine. A nice touch that helped me sleep - still needed earplugs. But rooms lack coffee machines - needs to be remedied -and water pressure in my room was quite low.

data.title: Business 5 nights easy
data.text:
Feels better than it is.  Which is not to say it's a bad place to stay.  I'd say it's the most upscale and best service within 30 miles.  It just about manages 4 star, mainly due to the character of the building and quality of the staff, then there is a lot of effort in keeping the rooms fresh.

Downers would be the cheap iron and board, the slightly worn bed linens and lack of curtains.  All the windows in my room had blinds only, and since I was facing Mass. St, the light from the street lamps never let it be dark.  I have an eye mask, but still, just a simple curtain would have made a big difference.

Lot's of good stores, bars and restaurants nearby.  I wasn't impressed with the hotel's offering.  Valet Parking is available, but free street side parking between 6pm and 9.30am made that something of an unnecessary expense for me personally.

The lobby is well appointed and quite impressive.  Everything felt clean and the TVs are large flat screens.  Bottled water in the room, but no coffee maker, which is an odd thing.  Bathroom was ok.  Small and shower over tub.  Shower head was really scaled up.  And some orange goop high on the walls made me question the thoroughness of the cleaning.  

Overall, its a good effort to modernize an old building without sacrificing too much of what makes it great.  A few details to address and it really would be a 4 star experience.

data.title: Tradition and History...
data.text: I love the Eldridge Hotel. The history of Lawrence and the Civil War clearly collide at the Eldridge Hotel. The history of the hotel, and it being burned by Quantrill's Raiders (more than once)is amazing and truly a sad story of the division of the States. The fact that the Eldridge survived and lives on is testament to the resolve and strength of Lawrence, Kansas...and the United States. The Eldridge is an old hotel, that has escaped being "old." The owners are constantly upgrading the facility. The dining room is beautiful, and in looks...a throwback in time...but quite appropriate. The food at the Eldridge is first rate, as is the service. I love the food at the Eldridge to the point that is one of, what I consider, the top 3 restaurants in Lawrence. Their Sunday Brunch is the best in town. The bar at the Eldridge is wonderful and one of, if not the best hotspots in town for adults. Great place. I have not mentioned the actual rooms/accommodations simply because...the entire Eldridge experience is special...and so are the rooms/suites. Because of their popularity, the Eldridge is under going a major expansion project...that promises to only expand the Eldridge experience.

data.title: History with a Modern touch
data.text: Great service from the time of booking and throughout our stay.  I would personally like to thank Brad that assisted me after I made an error on our reservation.  He was very helpful and understanding.  We stayed in the famous 506 room, it's beautiful! With a luxurious bedding, a sitting room, and a view of Massachusetts St. It exceeded expectations!   All staff have been friendly.  While staying in the hotel try out the Ten Restaurant it's fantastic!  Will come back!

data.title: Eldridge Extended
data.text:
I was on a last minute trip and the only room left was in the extension. It was a little pricy, and the building looks run down from the outside, but the lobby and rooms are nice.
Big wooden shutters close the windows, making it dark and quiet to sleep. The location a block of Mass helps that also.
Exterior door lock could use some work, had trouble getting both in and out of the building.

data.title: Everything was great.
data.text: Room service breakfast was really good! Food and drinks at Jayhawker were fantastic. Room was spotless and super comfortable. Perfect Location, only 1 parking ticket. Only complaint is not seeing the ghost :(

data.title: Clarinet Fest
data.text: My daughter and I stayed at the Eldridge Hotel for Clarinet Fest from August 4-7, 2016. The hotel, although old, was well maintained and the service was excellent. The food in the 10 Restaurant was fabulous.  The only negative was the $10 valet fee for parking the car, as we had to come and go a lot for Clarinet Fest.  I also thought it was odd that no one knew about Clarinet Fest even though the Eldridge was one of the hotels in the room block.  Overall a good trip though.

data.title: Really loud air conditioners ... Bring earplugs or broil.
data.text:
The hotel rooms have air conditioning units that are very loud.   Room 210 is particularly awful.  The air conditioner sits in the wall directly next to the bed.  Room 203 is a bit, but not much better.  

My stay: 
I stayed, for business, on a weeknight and originally got the dreaded room 210.  On check-in, the nice desk clerk apologized for the room ('there's no view and it has some problems... But it has a little bar; so it's kind of cute'). There was no other room available. Unfortunately, the 'bar' in the room is fairly pointless. There are no minibars in this hotel.  It is just an empty sort of shelf-thing.  At 1 AM, unable to sleep with the air conditioner chugging and roaring next to me, I called the front desk to see if there was another room.  The very nice desk clerk offered room 203 and I gathered my stuff and moved down the hall.  

Room 203 has an air conditioner that is almost as bad.  It is as loud, but at least 7 feet from the bed.  If 210 sounds like a lawnmower, this one sounds like a struggling vacuum cleaner.   Every time the fan turns on/off the unit shakes, squeals, hisses and would wake up anyone not in an actual coma.   

My colleague stayed in room 206 (?) and texted me at 2:30 AM: 'The air conditioner is too loud to sleep.  No sleep tonight. I'm canceling morning meeting and heading home early. ' 

The hotel has some charm. The really loud air conditioners remove any charm. 

There are ' soundmachines' in both rooms with a card that reads ' for your added comfort, we have provided sound machines to ensure you have a relaxing and restful night's sleep' Room 210 also has industrial foam earplugs on the nightstand.  This suggests that the hotel knows these rooms are loud and still rent them. This is deceptive and, frankly, rudely inhospitable. If the room is loud, the right thing to do is warn potential guests before booking the room. Even better, the hotel should invest in the property and fix the problem before a guests must suffer sleepless nights.  

I would strongly recommend not staying here if sleep is important to your enjoying your visit to Lawrence.  If you must stay here, find a room where the air conditioner is in part of the suite where a door can be closed between the bed and the air conditioner unit.  I think there are a few such rooms in the building.  

Last point: the restaurant.  On a previous stay for business (thankfully, no a/c needed that night), I ordered the fish special.  It was truly disgusting- greasy, over cooked, and tasted like salt (my colleague accurately said it tasted like old popcorn). I sent it back. The waiter tried to take it off my bill but came back to the table and said apologetically that he was 'sorry, I'm not able to remove the charge'.  It was a business lunch with a client, so I shrugged it off. But, this was really odd for a reasonably nice hotel.   

The place needs work/ management attention before I'll stay again.

owner_response.author: Lisa K, Public Relations Manager at Eldridge Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review of your stay on a recent business trip to Lawrence, Kansas. Many guests agree with you about The Eldridge Hotel’s charm and the friendly front desk staff. All management have read your review, and we are very sorry that your experience in your sleeping room led to lack of sleep. We’ve invested in our rooms to ensure guests receive a comfortable night’s rest (new bedding, beds, white noise machines, adjusting A/C units etc). The vibrant Downtown Lawrence nightlife is the reason the sound machines and earplugs are provided. We apologize you had to move rooms during your stay, and because of the occupancy of the hotel that night, the choices were slim where to move you. The A/C unit in the rooms that you mentioned have been checked and improved so this doesn’t happen to future guests. We know this doesn’t change your lodging experience. Please consider our apology and the updates we have made as you make your lodging decisions for your next trip to Lawrence. We would love to have you back to our historic property so that we may improve your opinion. As for your memory of a previous stay when you ate at our restaurant, apologies on our end are in order there too. Our kitchen strives to create excellent flavors and use fresh ingredients all under the guidance of our skilled chefs. We care deeply about customer satisfaction with our food and beverage. We do have policies for dishes that are rated unsatisfactory. If you sent your dish virtually untouched back to the kitchen, a discount should have been applied. We have reviewed the “comped meals” policy with all staff. We have updated our menus as of Sept. 1 and have brought in a new food & beverage director. We hope you’ll come back. The next time you visit The Eldridge Hotel or TEN restaurant, please ask for Ashley, our Food & Beverage Director, who would be happy to discuss more in person and help make this right.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best hotel in Lawrence
data.text: The other downtown Lawrence hotels cannot compete with the personal touch of the Eldridge staff. We've been staying at the Eldridge for several years now and the staff always welcomes us like honored guests. The bar serves the best drinks and the daily specials are very fun. The breakfast is not included but the experience in the hotel restaurant is always pleasant.  The staff is always responsive to issues so be sure to let the front desk know if you run into a problem with the rooms.

owner_response.author: Lisa K, Public Relations Manager at Eldridge Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review! We do pride ourselves on those special touches. We are so glad to have you as a loyal guest. Our front desk staff is very talented at attending to the needs of guests quickly and professionally. Our restaurant is about to revamp our menu, so on your return trip you may get to experience a new menu. Travel well. See you soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Historic Lawrence at its very best!
data.text: The Eldridge is definitely a place worth staying.  Not only its historical significant in Lawrence but the comfort and amenities are superb.  This was my second stay at the Eldridge and have nothing but praise.  The entire staff and the great care they give to each guest was amazing.  Also many wonderful restaurants and shopping all within walking distance.

owner_response.author: Lisa K, Public Relations Manager at Eldridge Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much. We pride ourselves on excellent customer service. Glad it was noted on this review. We look forward to your return, Kristin. We are glad you love the history and legacy of The Eldridge as much as our locals do. See you soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Girls' weekend
data.text: We stay at the Eldridge every year for our annual girls' weekend trip, and it is always wonderful.  It is a great hotel, comfortable and well appointed, with the perfect location in the middle of downtown Lawrence.  Love everything about it, and don't want to stay anywhere else.

owner_response.author: Lisa K, Public Relations Manager at Eldridge Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much. We look forward to your return. We love when you visit!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great!
data.text: This hotel was awesome. There is a bit of noise from the hip downtown area but its worth it to be so close to great food and stores. The beds were comfortable. The towls were plush. I was thrilled by how large the room was.

owner_response.author: Lisa K, Public Relations Manager at Eldridge Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your comment on TripAdvisor and for staying at the historic Eldridge, located, as you  mentioned, in the heart of Downtown Lawrence. Travel well and we hope to see you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
